public abstract class zeta.form.TextForm

(source file: TextForm.pizza)
java.lang.Object

   +----zeta.form.Form

           +----zeta.form.TextForm
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class TextForm
  extends Form
The abstract class of text forms.

An text form represents textual user input which may be interpreted in several ways.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: TextForm.pizza,v 1.6 2000/05/14 17:43:32 wg Exp $

TextForm(State)
Create a new text form from the given state.

state
The state of the text form.
style
The style of the text form

parse(Session, Locator, String[], int)
Parse the given sequence of words starting at index
style(Style)
Attach a style to an text form
unparse(Session)
Unparse the internal state of the form

State
The abstract class of text form states.
Style
The class of text form styles.

TextForm
protected TextForm(State state);
Create a new text form from the given state.

style
public Style style;
The style of the text form. Null means adapt to the displayed text.

state

public final State state;
The state of the text form.

style
public TextForm style(Style style);
Attach a style to an text form. Return this text form.

parse

public int parse(Session session,
                 Locator locator,
                 String[] words,
                 int start)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.FormFailed;
Parse the given sequence of words starting at index. Takes the first word in the sequence and sets and confirms it.

Overrides:

unparse

public String[] unparse(Session session);
Unparse the internal state of the form. Returns the state of the text.
